intro: Acleisanthes somalensis, commonly known as the Somali sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the dry regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has adapted to arid environments with succulent leaves that help store water. It grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and inland sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
